item.title: Biography
item.description: Yuan Yao is a final year Ph.D. student at University of Michigan, Ann Arbor and has joined Capecelatro Research Group since August 2016. He holds a Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical Engineering from the Hong Kong University of Science and Technology. Currently, his research focus is on numerical modeling and algorithm developments for the transport and deposition of fine particulates in turbulence, especially in the presence of cohesive forces such as electrostatics and van der Waals, which also involve reduced-order modeling and uncertainty quantification.

item.title: Projects
item.description: Modal Analysis of High-altitude Stratified Sheared Atmospheric Turbulence Formulated a new temperature treatment that decomposes temperature fluctuation from the mean gradient. Performed large LES simulations of stratified sheared troposphere turbulence at 6 km with Re= 1500 Developed and implemented a parallelized scalable DMD tool applicable to large atmosphere dataset. Performed DMD modal analysis on high-altitude atmospheric turbulence and identified key coherent structures. Electrohydrodynamic (EHD) Generation of Atmospheric Turbulence Performed linear stability analysis of ionized troposphere turbulence in the presence of EHD force.
